headline: F.D.A. CLEARS JOHNSON & JOHNSON BIRTH CONTROL PATCH
snippet: The drug maker Johnson & Johnson, based in New Brunswick, N.J., has received approval from the Food and Drug Administration for a new birth-control patch slightly larger than a postage stamp. The patch, called Ortho Evra, can be used as an...

headline: Bush Opposes Plan by Albany To Subsidize Birth Control
snippet: The Bush administration has refused to approve a New York proposal to provide subsidized contraceptive services to hundreds of thousands of low-income New Yorkers, placing Gov. George E. Pataki in a political quandary.    New York officials had been...

headline: Different Stories on Birth Control
snippet: One thing a married couple might be expected to agree on would be whether to practice birth control. But in many cases, a new study finds, that is not so.    An article in a recent issue of Studies in Family Planning reported significant...

headline: Birth Control, From 'Womb Veils' to Lysol
